TunableList.name: DEFAULT_ADD_TO_WORLD_AFFORDANCES

TunableList.name: DEFAULT_STACK_SCHEME_STATE_BASED_OVERRIDES
TunableList.display: Default Stack Scheme State Based Overrides
TunableList.description: A list of state values and stack schemes. If any of these state values are active, the first tuned active state value's stack scheme will be used instead of the default stack scheme. NOTE: Please discuss with a GPE before using this tuning as it potentially performance sensitive. Currently only NONE stack_schemes are tested and supported.

TunableTuple.description: Tuning common to instance and module tuning for stack_scheme overrides.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_icon_visual_state
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, a string for the UI to determine what treatment should be done on this object when it is in the inventory. If un-tuned, no treatment will be done.

Tunable.name: PUT_AWAY_AFFORDANCE
Tunable.description: An affordance for putting an object away in an inventory.

TunableList.name: SET_FAVORITES_SIM_INVENTORY_AFFORDANCES
TunableList.description: A list of affordances to set whether objects are favorites in a sim's inventory.

TunableList.name: STACK_SCHEME_OPTIONS
TunableList.description: This mapping allows special functionality for dynamic stack schemes. This allows things like: - Ability to specify a stack icon. - Ability to specify the tooltip text that is shown in the stack hovertip.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Various settings for the inventory stack scheme.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Use this icon for this stack scheme.

TunableTuple.name: tooltip
TunableTuple.description: If set, these strings are used for the tooltip of the stack.

TunableList.name: STACK_SORT_ORDER_STATES
TunableList.description: A list of states that dictate the order of an inventory stack. States lower down in this list will cause the object to be further down in the stack.

Tunable.name: is_value_order_inverted
Tunable.description: Normally, higher state value is better. For example, an IngredientQuality value of 0 is the worst and 10 is the best. However, there are some state values where lower is better, e.g. burnt state is tied to the burnt commodity where 0 is unburnt and 100 is completely burnt. This option should be set for these states.
